subject: Help with junit.org
msgSnippet: Hi, team JUnit. A quick recap: late last year, the organization that had been hosting junit.org for us (a group of stalwarts that started at ObjectMentor) lost
messageBody:
Hi, team JUnit.

A quick recap: late last year, the organization that had been hosting
junit.org for us (a group of stalwarts that started at ObjectMentor) lost
their serving files, apparently effectively irrevocably. Since then:

1) I've taken ownership of the junit.org domain on behalf of the JUnit
organization.
2) We've transfered the github repo to the junit-team team account.

I think the best place to end up would be to serve junit.org from github
pages at junit-team.github.com/junit. I've begun taking steps in this
direction, but could use help navigating the DNS and github-administration
tasks involved.

My guess is that with one or two focused volunteers, we can get the major
issues knocked out in under a week. Anyone up for the challenge?

Thanks,

David Saff


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
